2.caption_en:
The slide contrasts McKinsey’s projection of 12 integrated ecosystems (creating an estimated $70 trillion global revenue pool by 2030) with Ecosystemizer’s 10 consumer “life areas,” emphasizing a customer-centered shift in market ecosystems.

{
  "artifact_type": "presentation_slide",
  "title": "The emerging market ecosystems / networks from different perspectives",
  "language": "English",
  "layout": "three_column",
  "elements": [
    {
      "position": "left",
      "type": "text_block",
      "content_summary": "Introductory text explaining that consultants (e.g., McKinsey, BCG) analyze emerging market networks; McKinsey predicts 12 distinct ecosystems responsible for a $70 trillion global revenue pool by 2030; other experts (Ecosystemizer, Prof. Julian Kawohl) describe similar concepts as 'life areas'; emphasis on putting humans/customers at the center and understanding customer needs to identify value pools and roles."
    },
    {
      "position": "center",
      "type": "diagram",
      "source": "McKinsey",
      "diagram_type": "flower/cluster",
      "description": "Twelve distinct ecosystems illustrated as petal-like value pools around a central hub representing integrated network economy; annotated approximate revenue sizes and a summed global revenue pool of ~$70 trillion (2030 projection).",
      "approximate_values_trillion_usd": {
        "B2B marketplace": 17.0,
        "B2B services": 14.3,
        "B2C marketplace": 6.8,
        "Health": 6.2,
        "Public services": 5.7,
        "Housing": 4.0,
        "Global corporate services": 4.7,
        "Education": 3.1,
        "Digital content": 2.5,
        "Travel and hospitality": 2.7,
        "Mobility and logistics": 2.2,
        "Wealth and protection": 0.9,
        "total_approx": 70.1
      }
    },
    {
      "position": "right",
      "type": "diagram",
      "source": "Ecosystemizer",
      "diagram_type": "wheel",
      "description": "A circular 'life areas' wheel mapping ~10 consumer life domains (e.g., mobility, health, work, spirituality/social, entertainment) with the individual at the center, illustrating a consumer-centric segmentation of ecosystems."
    }
  ],
  "key_messages": [
    "McKinsey identifies 12 integrated ecosystems summing to an estimated ~$70 trillion global revenue pool by 2030.",
    "Ecosystemizer presents a complementary perspective using ~10 consumer 'life areas' centered on the individual.",
    "Common theme: shift toward customer-centric ecosystem design and the importance of understanding emerging customer needs to identify value pools and roles."
  ],
  "sources": [
    "McKinsey (diagram)",
    "Ecosystemizer (diagram)"
  ],
  "confidence_estimate": 0.78
}

3.caption_en:
An infographic in a radial "petal" layout showing approximate market sizes by sector around a central platform icon; the largest petals are B2B marketplace (~17.0) and B2B services (~14.3), while other sectors include health (~6.2), B2C marketplace (~6.8), public services (~5.7), and smaller segments like digital content (~2.5) and wealth protection (~0.9).
